  • hare bol

    • #The Hare Krishna movement is a Western branch of the Bengali bhakti trad The founder of the bhakti tradition was Chaitanya Mahaprabhu (1485–1534?), who believed that chanting the names of Go A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami (1896–1977) brought the Hare Krishna movement to the United States in 1966.

    The story of the Jagannath Temple in Puri, Odisha, India, is about a king who built a temple for a deity after findin #The story King Indradyumna ruled over the Malava Country in Satya Yuga. King Indradyumna was a devotee of Lord Vishnu. In his dreams, Vishnu told Indradyumna to build a temple for him. Indradyumna sent his priest, Vidyapati, to find the deity. Vidyapati found the deity, Nilmadhav, in a cave in the Nilachal Hills. Vidyapati married Vishwavasu's daughter, Lalita, to convince Vishwavasu to show him the deity. Indradyumna traveled to Odisha to find the idol. The temple was buried under sand after Brahma meditated for a long time. Indradyumna was told by a celestial voice to carve idols from a floating log on the seashore. Indradyumna built a temple and enshrined the wooden images of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, and Subhadra.
